keyword: how many calories are in a cheese slice
title: How Many Calories Are in a Cheese Slice?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a cheese slice, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, sodium, and easy variations for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Cheese Slice?
assumptions: Standard processed American cheese slice (~21g), like Kraft Singles; melted or as-is, no additional ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, type (e.g., cheddar vs. processed), slice thickness, and processing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cheese slice contains about 80 kcal and 5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a cheese slice?
faqs.a: Approximately 80 kcal for a standard processed American slice.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one cheese slice?
faqs.a: About 5 g of protein per slice.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a cheese slice?
faqs.a: Around 400 mg, which is notable for processed varieties.

faqs.q: Does cheese slice type affect calories?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”processed is lower (~80 kcal), while natural cheddar can be 110+ kcal.

faqs.q: Are cheese slices high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 4 g saturated fat per slice, so enjoy in moderation.
